judges: Before Mitchell, C. J. Fell, Brown, Mestrezat, Potter, Elkin and Stewart, JJ.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Brown,
As the appellants have no interest in the fund to be distributed, for reasons given in the opinion in the appeals of Orville Horwitz et al., ante, p. 548, filed herewith, these appeals are dismissed, with costs.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Brown,

attorneys: Thomas Learning, for Charles Cambios Norris, M. D., appellant.
William Drayton, for Elizabeth N. Brown, appellant.
Henry S. Drimiker, Jr., with him II. Gordon MeCouch and Samuel Diokson, for Charles Norris et al., appellants.
casebody.head_matter:
Norris’s Estate
(No. 2).
April 22, 1907:
Argued Jan. 22, 1907.
Appeals, Nos. 349, 353, 354, 355, 357 and 360, by Charles Cambios Norris, M. I)., et al. from decree of C. P. No. 3, Assignee’s and Trustee’s Docket F. (O. C. P.) 1863-1869, No. 28, dismissing exceptions to auditor’s report In the Matter of the First and Final Account of Henry Norris, trustee of the Fairhill Estate of Henry Norris under the will of Joseph Parker Norris, the elder, deceased, filed by his executors, J. Parker Norris and Holstein Dellaven.
Before Mitchell, C. J. Fell, Brown, Mestrezat, Potter, Elkin and Stewart, JJ.
Appeal dismissed.
Thomas Learning, for Charles Cambios Norris, M. D., appellant.
William Drayton, for Elizabeth N. Brown, appellant.
Henry S. Drimiker, Jr., with him II. Gordon MeCouch and Samuel Diokson, for Charles Norris et al., appellants.
